title: British Journal of Health Psychology
text: The British Journal of Health Psychology is a quarterly <a href="peer-review">peer-review</a>ed <a href="scientific%20journal">scientific journal</a> covering <a href="health%20psychology">health psychology</a>. It was established in 1996, when it was split off from the existing "<a href="British%20Journal%20of%20Clinical%20Psychology">British Journal of Clinical Psychology</a>". It is published by <a href="Wiley-Blackwell">Wiley-Blackwell</a> on behalf of the <a href="British%20Psychological%20Society">British Psychological Society</a>. The <a href="editors-in-chief">editors-in-chief</a> are Madelynne Arden (<a href="Sheffield%20Hallam%20University">Sheffield Hallam University</a>) and Joseph Chilcot (<a href="King%27s%20College%20London">King's College London</a>). According to the "<a href="Journal%20Citation%20Reports">Journal Citation Reports</a>", the journal has a 2018 <a href="impact%20factor">impact factor</a> of 2.472, ranking it 45th out of 130 journals in the category "Psychology, Clinical".
